meanings.definition: To place or set on or as if on a pedestal.
meanings.sent1: She pedestaled the trophy on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The statue was pedestaled in the center of the square.
meanings.sent3: The cat pedestaled itself on the highest bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness pedestaled her in everyone's eyes.
meanings.sent5: The sun pedestaled the mountain peak with its golden light.

meanings.sent1: He pedestaled his favorite singer above all others.
meanings.sent2: The queen was pedestaled as a symbol of grace and power.
meanings.sent3: The dog pedestaled itself by learning to balance a treat on its nose.
meanings.sent4: His talent pedestaled him to the top of the music charts.
meanings.sent5: The moon pedestaled the night sky with its shimmering presence.
